column1: Whence did he come? What is his purpose? Who can this old man be? whispered the wondering crowd.Meanwhile
column4: was pursuing his solitary walk along the centre of the street. As he drew near the advancing soldiers
column5: and as the roll of their drum came full upon his ear
column6: the old man raised himself to a loftier mien
column7: while the decrepitude of age seemed to fall from his shoulders
column8: leaving him in gray but unbroken dignity. Now
column9: he marched onward with a warrior's step
column10: keeping time to the military music. Thus the aged form advanced on one side
column11: and the whole parade of soldiers and magistrates on the other
column13: when scarcely twenty yards remained between
column14: the old man grasped his staff by the middle
column15: and held it before him like a leader's truncheon.
